hints_html:
Remember that the Product Rule states that:

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle (f(x)\times g(x))'=f'(x)g(x)+f(x)g'(x)\end{aligned}\]
hints_raw:
Remember that the Product Rule states that:
:<math>\displaystyle
(f(x)\times g(x))'=f'(x)g(x)+f(x)g'(x)
</math>
question: 1 (c)
sols_html:
Using the Product Rule, we get:

\[\begin{aligned} f'(x)&=(x\cos{x})'\\ &=(x)'(\cos{x})+x(\cos{x})'\\ &=\cos{x}+x(-\sin{x})\\ &=\cos{x}-x\sin{x}\end{aligned}\]
statement_raw:
{{Math Exam Resources/Courses/MATH100/December 2010/Question 1/Statement/Header}}

Find the derivative of
:<math>\displaystyle
f(x)=x\cos(x)
</math>
